meanings.definition: Capable of being understood or perceived intuitively.
meanings.sent1: The concept was intuitable even to young children.
meanings.sent2: Her emotions were intuitable through her expressive eyes.
meanings.sent3: It was intuitable that the cat wanted more treats by its persistent meowing.
meanings.sent4: The beauty of the sunset was so intuitable, it brought tears to her eyes.
meanings.sent5: The melody was so intuitable that it stayed in his mind long after the music stopped.

meanings.definition: Able to be grasped or comprehended without the need for conscious reasoning.
meanings.sent1: The instructions were intuitable even for beginners.
meanings.sent2: The joy on her face was intuitable to everyone around.
meanings.sent3: It was intuitable that the joke was hilarious by the loud laughter that followed.
meanings.sent4: The truth in his words was so intuitable, it silenced the room.
meanings.sent5: The scent of fresh flowers was so intuitable, it brought back memories of spring.
